Adam Topaz said:

I would say, one PR for the int_linear_equiv_of_add_equiv (or whatever other name we want), one for free_abelian_group.basis, one for abelianization.equiv_of_equiv (or whatever name we want) which should include the missing dsimp lemma, and one for the final result.

All done prepared, but probably some lemma naming can use some refinement:

  • https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib/pull/11456
  • https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib/pull/11465
  • https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib/pull/11466
  • https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib/pull/11469
Joachim Breitner has marked this topic as resolved.

@Joachim Breitner thanks! I left a few comments on these PRs but they generally look great!

At least for me, it's easier to keep track of PRs to review if you request a review from me on github.
Also, we generally use the PR tags awaiting-review and awaiting-author to keep track of what maintainers should look at.
ok, that’s good to know – it feels a bit passive aggressive, so I hesitated with that button :-)
And 1½ weeks, and a bunch of helpful, patient and educating reviews (thanks) later, it's in. Good first contributer experience!
